title: Followgraph for Mastodon

last_post.content:
What a wonderful tool!!!

https://followgraph.vercel.app/

I found many people that I did not know that have arrived on Mastodon and even some journals and newspapers... It's a great tool to expand your network on #Mastodon

The tool is made by @gabipurcaru, thanks for creating this!

title: What Can We Learn from Barnes & Noble's Surprising Turnaround?

last_post.content:
Enjoyed reading this one.

I remember visiting Daunt Books in London. It felt like a real bookstore. Like someone who cares about books ran it!

Caring is such a scarce resource. It feels surprising to me that even in creative fields where that should be the case for people who work in it, it’s not a prevalent attitude.

I’d work with, invest in, and buy into people who care, any day.

https://tedgioia.substack.com/p/what-can-we-learn-from-barnes-and

title: Bring Back Blogs! January 2023

last_post.content:
In January of 2023 will you publish at least 3 posts to your blog or RSS feed? If so join Bring Back Blogging, an experiment to encourage blogging by listing the bloggers who participate and allowing readers to discover new content.

So far over 130 bloggers joined, including yours truly. I blog regularly, so it was a no brainer.

https://bringback.blog

#blogging #rss

title: Three years on, the pandemic — and our response — have been jolting. Here's what even the experts didn't see coming

last_post.content:
This shouldn’t have surprised anyone and it’s very frustrating the extent to which many academics and scientists living in their own echo chamber apparently completely missed the declining trajectory of trust in institutions and the ways that grifters in fact actively exploit and exacerbate it.

https://www.statnews.com/2022/12/27/covid19-pandemic-what-most-surprised-experts/

title: Romanian Cops Did Not Find Andrew Tate Because Of His Greta Thunberg Video

last_post.content:
Yeah, so my bullshit detector turned out to be accurate.

I'm always leery of social media fairy-tales and this one felt *especially* like wishcasting. But I find myself particularly annoyed at some of the Extremely Online influencers who click-harvested off of this.

This is why our information ecosystem is filled with raw sewage, folks.

https://www.calmdownben.com/p/romanian-cops-did-not-find-andrew?sd=pf

title: Romanian Cops Did Not Find Andrew Tate Because Of His Greta Thunberg Video

last_post.content: Because I believe in debunking misinformation even when it's just absurdly delightful to believe it, I'll link to this article that makes a strong case that the pizza box was not the missing piece of evidence needed to raid that guy's villa https://www.calmdownben.com/p/romanian-cops-did-not-find-andrew

title: Lead and Cadmium Could Be in Your Dark Chocolate

last_post.content: Read the BBC story about the guy suing Hershey for high levels of lead and cadmium and thought, “They should be able to keep the lead and cadmium out of the chocolate”. Then I read the Consumer Reports piece on the problem. Wow. You should, too. https://www.consumerreports.org/health/food-safety/lead-and-cadmium-in-dark-chocolate-a8480295550/

last_post.content:
Shipping projects on the last Friday of the year is good actually. 😅

My annual portfolio refresh ✨ https://lynnandtonic.com

title: Home · Pinafore

last_post.content:
OK, so https://pinafore.social is awesome. The kind of web app I love. Client-only, using cross-site requests with a browser-stored API key to access your Mastodon instance and give you a way better web UI than the default Mastodon... this is the best of the Open Web.

Way to go @nolan, very very cool.

title: Institute of Network Cultures | Geert Lovink: Extinction Internet

last_post.content:
Geert Lovink’s inaugural lecture:

“*Extinction Internet* marks the end of an era of possibilities & speculations, when adaptation is no longer an option. During the internet’s Lost Decade, we’ve been rearranging the deck chairs on the Titanic under the inspirational guidance of the consultancy class. What’s to be done to uphold the inevitable? We need tools that decolonize, redistribute value, conspire & organize.”

https://networkcultures.org/blog/publication/extinction-internet/

title: rheingold.com/texts/IntroToCoo...

last_post.content:
After learning more myself, I taught an online introduction to cooperation studies course for 8 years: Weekly videoconferences, ongoing forum, blogs, wiki. Subjects were biological basis of cooperation, biological and cultural evolution of cooperation, social dilemmas, institutions for collective action, technologies of cooperation.

I've bundled the syllabus and links to recordings of all lectures and videoconferences in a free PDF:

http://rheingold.com/texts/IntroToCooperationStudies.pdf

(2/2)

#MastodonGuides Dec 29, 2022

This is fantastic tool!

Followgraph for Mastodon >>> https://followgraph.vercel.app/

This tool allows you to expand your connection graph and find new people to follow. It works by looking up your (or any other) account's "follows' follows".

title: Five key findings from the 2022 UN Population Prospects

last_post.content:
RT @redouad@twitter.com

'Five key findings from the 2022 UN Population Prospects' was our most-read article this year!

- World population now 8+ billion
- Projected to peak around 10.4 billion in 2086
- Global fertility rate has dropped to 2.3
- India's population is now > China
https://ourworldindata.org/world-population-update-2022

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/redouad/status/1608743947014385669

title: A tiny paper broke the George Santos scandal, but no one paid attention

last_post.content:
Do you know how many times I've heard over the past few days how much the media is failing to follow the money in this story about the newly elected Rep. George Santos? This story makes it clear that's exactly what happened.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/media/2022/12/29/north-shore-leader-santos-scoop/

So let's follow the money, shall we? Starting with Mr. Santos' latest filing for The Devolder Organization, which is apparently responsible for his sudden unexplained wealth.

http://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/CorporationSearch/ConvertTiffToPDF?storagePath=COR%5C2021%5C0601%5C00184778.Tif&documentNumber=L21000206150

The organization lists its address as 336 N. Babcock St. Ste 104, and says another organization at the same address but Ste 101 is there called D&D International Investment Services Inc.

Both are affiliated with an individual named Devaughn Dames, who appears to be both a physician and a CFO somehow. He's also very passionate about spreading his knowledge about how to handle your money wisely. His linkedin page mentions both companies. He also seems to be an IT expert; previous domains include https://web.archive.org/web/20160518071721/http://www.manageditsolutions.net/about.html

One of Mr. Dames' email addresses (dev.dames at gmail) was used to register the vanity domain devaughndames[.]com. Firefox didn't like what that site tried to do when I visited it, but it loaded an empty page that had the heading "Financial Educational Services." But the pop-up takes you to a domain called myuwe.net, which is for an entity called United Wealth Education.

Now, UWE is full of stock photos and videos, and there isn't much there about who runs it. And after spending a few minutes on this site, you'll probably come away with the conclusion that the site is tied to some type of scam.

Well, if you look up the name of what Myuwe.com used to be called -- Financial Educational Services -- you'll see they were shut down JUST THIS YEAR by the US Federal Trade Commission for being a giant pyramid scheme that bilked people out of more than $213 million.

https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/news/press-releases/2022/05/ftc-shuts-down-credit-repair-pyramid-scheme-financial-education-services-which-bilked-more-213

How's that for following the money? :) Wait, I'm not done yet.

title: authors.elsevier.com/a/1gKNX3Q...

last_post.content:
Thrilled to share the lab’s first paper, which just came out in
Current Biology: https://authors.elsevier.com/a/1gKNX3QW8R%7Efdk
This project, spearheaded by postdoc extraordinaire
Sander Liessem, was our first foray into the world of #insulin signaling in #Drosophila. Just like in humans, worms, and mice, insulin is key to regulating #fly metabolism. Different from vertebrates, however, a major population of insulin-producing cells (IPCs) sits right on top of the fly’s brain and releases insulin into circulation.

title: Nazi Germany Used Honorary Consuls to Advance Agenda Globally, Records Show

last_post.content:
Nazi Germany Used Honorary Consuls to Advance Agenda Globally, Records Show
--
ProPublica & ICIJ used declassified intelligence documents and media accounts to ID about 20 honorary consuls suspected of supporting the Third Reich through espionage & other illicit activities.

They largely lived & worked in neutral countries in Latin America, Europe & Africa, where Nazis sought to cultivate allies or gain an advantage.

https://www.propublica.org/article/shadow-diplomats-nazi-germany-spies-honorary-consuls

title: Electric vehicle batteries would have cost as much as a million dollars in the 1990s

last_post.content:
RT @TomChivers@twitter.com

absolutely amazing post from @_HannahRitchie@twitter.com: the battery in a Tesla Model S would have cost $1 million in 1990. Electric car sales growth is exponential and is driven by (and in turn drives) exponential drops in battery price https://hannahritchie.substack.com/p/ev-battery-costs

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/TomChivers/status/1608776677265649669

title: I got myself banned from Elon Musk’s Twitter. Why you should, too

last_post.content:
"By banning some of us, Musk is sending a message to everyone else: Comply with the dictator or lose access. Twitter has become a virtual simulation of authoritarian rule."

"But Musk didn’t build Twitter. We, collectively, turned the bird app into a consequential power. If it remains under the control of a man who sees journalists as enemies, we have a moral responsibility to fly the coop."
--@gilduran on getting banned from #twitter.
https://www.sfchronicle.com/opinion/openforum/article/elon-musk-twitter-ban-censorship-17680044.php

title: Samuel Pepys: Diary, Letters, Family Tree, Maps, Encyclopedia, Discussion and more

last_post.content:
"I started https://pepysdiary.com 20 years ago and that means… On 1st January, Samuel Pepys' diary will start for the third time!"

So much more than a diary, or a blog, @philgyford's project remains one of the most beautiful demonstrations of carefully woven hypertext. See also the encyclopedia (https://www.pepysdiary.com/encyclopedia), the maps (https://www.pepysdiary.com/encyclopedia/map/209/), the family tree ... uh oh, Phil that one broke!

Anyway, it's on my short list of best sites ever.

title: Opinion | Once an Open Sewer, New York Harbor Now Teems With Life. Thank the Clean Water Act.

last_post.content:
50 years ago, the harbor of New York City was a sewer, filled with human trash and pollutants

But congress passed the Clean Water Act and it helped enormously, so …

… today wildlife has staged a remarkable comeback, and the water quality is high. They’ve seen humpback whales in the Hudson River one mile from Times Square, and there’s a thousand breeding pairs of heron

Smart ecological legislation works

“Friend” link to NYT story: https://www.nytimes.com/2022/12/30/opinion/new-york-harbor-clean-water-act.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqYhlSlUYAybSRdkhrxqAwv7C3_ktgWX9aSicUzxF1aEeB4WJ_QLSbLZufZ461CjdRMNENPVnYs1O-dJlHh4nTRi08NzDkY4ZIi4xpMW5VD1s1JuUA_Vk-2awKzTlduo6zbfg7lfYaDG9WaKJ03N1cAl1sNAyIwHRrH8Mx6zBFOdz3cAvnqtyQ8AnGkpTIXWCrPLqCB5hON6ZbBi66gY-WOhRWzq7jsfLovtbM10UUQSaOSs5tWUs69pcOscVPLL8LXMjf8n-gLYQCA94PcyvKmMBXv9Vu1OojbRc8kM&referringSource=articleShare

title: retractionwatch.com/2022/12/30...

last_post.content:
Imagine you caught a prof plagiarizing your blog and you asked them about it...

...and you received this response:

"I regret to inform you that blogs are not scientific texts, published by academic publishers, so their value is nil! [...] I forward these delusional e-mails of yours to the lawyer who will, if appropriate, reply to you."

🤦 🤦 🤦

An investigation by the university into the allegations has opened.

@retractionwatch https://retractionwatch.com/2022/12/30/university-to-investigate-adjunct-professor-after-allegations-of-plagiarism-and-legal-threats/
#Science #OpenScience @academicchatter

title: Mastodon—and the pros and cons of moving beyond Big Tech gatekeepers

last_post.content:
I remember how excited I was in the nineties, thinking that a shaggy, open, unpredictable, democratic internet had triumphed over AOL and the other closed commercial networks. Then came surveillence-driven social media.

Could a phoenix be rising from the ashes of Twitter?

https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2022/12/mastodon-highlights-pros-and-cons-of-moving-beyond-big-tech-gatekeepers/

title: search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/Corp...

last_post.content:
Do you know how many times I've heard over the past few days how much the media is failing to follow the money in this story about the newly elected Rep. George Santos? This story makes it clear that's exactly what happened.

https://www.theleaderonline.com/single-post/santos-filings-now-claim-net-worth-of-11-million (edit: replaced the paywalled WaPo story about how the MSM missed the big scoop with the big scoop itself).

So let's follow the money, shall we? Starting with Mr. Santos' latest filing for The Devolder Organization, which is apparently responsible for his sudden unexplained wealth.

http://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/CorporationSearch/ConvertTiffToPDF?storagePath=COR%5C2021%5C0601%5C00184778.Tif&documentNumber=L21000206150

The organization lists its address as 336 N. Babcock St. Ste 104, and says another organization at the same address but Ste 101 is there called D&D International Investment Services Inc.

Both are affiliated with an individual named Devaughn Dames, who appears to be both a physician and a CFO somehow. He's also very passionate about spreading his knowledge about how to handle your money wisely. His linkedin page mentions both companies. He also seems to be an IT expert; previous domains include https://web.archive.org/web/20160518071721/http://www.manageditsolutions.net/about.html

One of Mr. Dames' email addresses (dev.dames at gmail) was used to register the vanity domain devaughndames[.]com. Firefox didn't like what that site tried to do when I visited it, but it loaded an empty page that had the heading "Financial Educational Services." But the pop-up takes you to a domain called myuwe.net, which is for an entity called United Wealth Education.

Now, UWE is full of stock photos and videos, and there isn't much there about who runs it. And after spending a few minutes on this site, you'll probably come away with the conclusion that the site is tied to some type of scam.

Well, if you look up the name of what Myuwe.com used to be called -- Financial Educational Services -- you'll see they were shut down JUST THIS YEAR by the US Federal Trade Commission for being a giant pyramid scheme that bilked people out of more than $213 million.

https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/news/press-releases/2022/05/ftc-shuts-down-credit-repair-pyramid-scheme-financial-education-services-which-bilked-more-213

How's that for following the money? :) Wait, I'm not done yet.

title: Mathematics Research Communities

last_post.content:
Two AMS Math Research Communities in 2023 for #ECR early-career researchers* of interest to #ComplexSystems #ComplexNetworks #networks people:

Ricci Curvatures of Graphs and Applications to Data Science https://www.ams.org/programs/research-communities/2023MRC-RicciCurves

Complex Social Systems https://www.ams.org/programs/research-communities/2023MRC-SocialSystems (@masonporter is one of the organizers)

App deadline Feb 15, 2023.

* graduating w/ PhD w/in 2 yrs, or rcvd PhD < 5ya, exceptions allowed

title: Twitter in data-protection probe after '400 million' user details up for sale

last_post.content: Twitter in data-protection probe after '400 million' user details up for sale https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-64109777
